page.title: 01Village Green,Ravensthorpe
page.content: Ravensthorpe's Village Green is made especially attractive by 2 large beech trees The larger one was planted in l897 for Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee, the smaller in l935 for King George V's Silver Jubilee and the little red oak on the bottom green was planted for the presentQueen Elizabeth ll's silver in l977.All 3 have coins of the year in bottles at the roots, but please do not start digging - they are of little value now! The trees are much prized and in good condition. The Green is sometimes used for social activities.Occasionally a travelling theatre group set up here and give an open air performance.During the Wool Festival the coconut shy was on one side, while a large crowd watched the Morris Dancers on the other.The Green is well cared for and we can take some pride in our surroundings.
